announcements.title: Welcome to Fountain!
announcements.message: New onboarding portal is now live. Check out our updated resources section.

faq.question: How do I access my email and company accounts?
faq.answer: You should have been provided access to your email account, and provided a link to slack. If you haven't received these for whatever reason please contact Daniel Raphael (Daniel@fountain.net).

faq.question: Where can I find information about benefits?
faq.answer: Benefits information is available in the Employee Handbook section under Essential Resources. You can also contact HR at hr@fountain.net for specific questions.

faq.question: What should I do on my first day?
faq.answer: On your first day, you'll complete new hire paperwork, set up your accounts, review the employee handbook, and meet with your manager. Check the First Day Checklist section and select your role (NPs, RNS, CS, or MAs) to see role-specific tasks.

faq.question: How do I request software access?
faq.answer: Submit software access requests through the Technology & Tools section. You can also contact IT Support directly at it-support@fountain.net.

faq.question: Who is my onboarding buddy?
faq.answer: Your onboarding buddy will be introduced to you on Day 1. They're an experienced team member who can answer questions and help you navigate your first weeks.

faq.question: Where can I find training materials for my role?
faq.answer: Visit the First Day Checklist section and click on your role button (NPs, RNS, CS, or MAs) to access role-specific day one tasks and training materials.

faq.question: How do I set up direct deposit?
faq.answer: You can set up direct deposit through Gusto. Log in to your Gusto account and navigate to the Payroll section to add your bank account information. If you need assistance, contact HR at hr@fountain.net.

faq.question: What's the dress code?
faq.answer: Fountain follows a business casual dress code. For remote work, maintain a professional appearance during video calls. When in doubt, it's better to be slightly overdressed than underdressed.

faq.question: How do I request time off?
faq.answer: Time off requests should be submitted through Gusto. Log in to your account, navigate to Time Off, and submit your request. Make sure to check with your manager about team coverage before submitting.

faq.question: Where can I find my employee ID number?
faq.answer: Your employee ID number can be found in your Gusto account under your profile information, or in your welcome email. You can also contact HR at hr@fountain.net if you need assistance locating it.

faq.question: What are the company holidays?
faq.answer: Company holidays are listed in the Employee Handbook under Essential Resources. You'll also receive notifications about upcoming holidays through company communications.

faq.question: How do I access my benefits information?
faq.answer: Benefits information is available in Gusto under the Benefits section. You can also find detailed information in the Employee Handbook. For specific questions, contact HR at hr@fountain.net.

faq.question: What should I do if I have technical issues?
faq.answer: For technical issues, contact IT Support at it-support@fountain.net. For urgent matters, you can also reach out to Daniel Raphael on Slack. Include details about the issue and any error messages you're seeing.

faq.question: What are Fountain's contractor policies and requirements?
faq.answer: Detailed information about contractor policies, including payment terms, work expectations, and contractor responsibilities, can be found in the Fountain Contractor Policies document. This document is available in the Essential Resources section and is required reading for all contractors. For specific questions, contact HR at hr@fountain.net.

faq.question: What professional standards am I expected to follow?
faq.answer: Fountain maintains high professional standards for all team members. The Fountain Professional Standards document outlines expectations for conduct, communication, patient care, and professional behavior. This document is available in the Essential Resources section and should be reviewed on your first day. All team members are expected to adhere to these standards.

faq.question: How do I access the systems and tools I need for my role?
faq.answer: The Systems Doc provides comprehensive information about all systems, tools, and platforms used at Fountain, including access instructions and setup procedures. This document is available in the Essential Resources section under Tools & Systems. If you need help accessing specific systems, contact IT Support at it-support@fountain.net.

faq.question: What is my status as a contractor at Fountain?
faq.answer: As a contractor, your relationship with Fountain is governed by the terms outlined in the Fountain Contractor Policies document. This document covers your contractor status, payment structure, work expectations, and other important details. Review this document carefully and contact HR at hr@fountain.net if you have questions about your contractor status.

faq.question: What are the communication standards I should follow?
faq.answer: Professional communication standards are detailed in the Fountain Professional Standards document. This includes guidelines for patient communication, team communication, documentation requirements, and professional etiquette. All team members must follow these standards to ensure consistent, high-quality service delivery.

faq.question: Where can I find information about the software and platforms I'll be using?
faq.answer: The Systems Doc contains detailed information about all software, platforms, and tools used at Fountain, including login procedures, system requirements, and usage guidelines. This document is regularly updated and can be found in the Essential Resources section. For technical setup assistance, contact IT Support at it-support@fountain.net.

faq.question: What happens if I don't follow the professional standards?
faq.answer: All team members are expected to adhere to the Fountain Professional Standards. Failure to meet these standards may result in corrective action. The Professional Standards document outlines expectations and consequences. If you have questions about specific standards or situations, contact HR at hr@fountain.net for clarification.

faq.question: How often are contractor policies updated?
faq.answer: Contractor policies may be updated periodically to reflect changes in company practices or legal requirements. The Fountain Contractor Policies document shows the last updated date. You'll be notified of significant policy changes. Always refer to the most current version of the document in the Essential Resources section.

faq.question: What systems do I need to set up on my first day?
faq.answer: The Systems Doc provides a complete list of systems and tools you'll need to access, along with setup instructions. Key systems typically include email, Slack, Gusto, and role-specific platforms. Review the Systems Doc in the Essential Resources section and contact IT Support at it-support@fountain.net if you encounter any setup issues.

faq.question: Are there specific documentation requirements I need to follow?
faq.answer: Documentation requirements are outlined in the Fountain Professional Standards document. This includes patient documentation, communication records, and administrative documentation. All team members must follow these requirements to ensure compliance and quality of care. Review the Professional Standards document for detailed guidelines.

faq.question: What should I do if I have questions about the contractor policies?
faq.answer: If you have questions about the Fountain Contractor Policies, first review the complete document in the Essential Resources section. For clarification or specific situations not covered in the document, contact HR at hr@fountain.net. It's important to understand these policies as they govern your work relationship with Fountain.

glossary.definition: Nurse Practitioner - Advanced practice registered nurses who provide primary and specialty healthcare.
Registered Nurse - Licensed healthcare professionals who provide patient care and coordinate treatment plans.
Customer Support - Team members who assist patients and handle customer inquiries.
Medical Assistant - Healthcare professionals who perform administrative and clinical tasks.
Human Resources Information System - Software system for managing employee data and HR processes.
Learning Management System - Platform for delivering and tracking training courses.
Paid Time Off - Vacation days, sick days, and personal time that employees can use.
Employee Assistance Program - Confidential counseling and support services available to employees and their families.
Retirement savings plan that allows employees to contribute a portion of their salary on a pre-tax basis.
Flexible Spending Account - Pre-tax account for eligible healthcare or dependent care expenses.
Health Savings Account - Tax-advantaged savings account for qualified medical expenses, available with high-deductible health plans.
Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act - Allows employees to continue health insurance coverage after leaving employment.
Wage and Tax Statement - Form provided annually showing total earnings and taxes withheld for the year.
Employee's Withholding Certificate - Form used to determine how much federal income tax to withhold from paychecks.
Employment Eligibility Verification form - Required for all new employees to verify identity and work authorization.
Non-Disclosure Agreement - Legal agreement to protect confidential company information.
Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act - Federal law protecting patient health information privacy.

firstDayChecklist.task: Set up email and company accounts

NPs.task: Download slack on your computer and mobile phone (go to www.slack.com)
Update your slack & intercom profiles by adding your picture
Complete the Abyde training: (look for the email from Abyde)
Complete the Akute Identity proofing setup (Check Slack DM)
Please send us a professional photo of you for your Doxy profile
Please send us a scanned copy of your ID: Front and Back
Please complete the direct deposit setup
Please send a copy of your licenses + DEA (if applicable), NPI number
Please provide contact number, address, and time zone information

CS.task: Refer to this training guide for relevant training
